meanings.sent1: She coerects her spelling errors before submitting the assignment.
meanings.sent2: He always coerects his grammar mistakes after proofreading.
meanings.sent3: The teacher coerects the math problem and shows the correct solution.
meanings.sent4: His guidance coerects our path when we are lost in confusion.
meanings.sent5: Practice coerects imperfections and leads to improvement.

meanings.definition: To make right or amend a mistake.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic coerects the car engine issue quickly.
meanings.sent2: She coerects her misunderstanding by apologizing.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to cook dinner alone coerects into ordering pizza.
meanings.sent4: A sincere apology coerects the hurt feelings and restores harmony.
meanings.sent5: Hard work coerects errors and paves the way for success.
